newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Major holders to sell Team Concepts stake.
newsitem.headline: Major holders to sell Team Concepts stake.

text.p: Team Concepts Holdings Ltd said on Wednesday its major shareholders had entered into an agreement to sell their combined 46.3 percent stake in the firm.
The stake purchaser will be required to make a general offer for the company shares, the statement said.

Team Concepts said the majority shareholders -- Holystone Ltd, Hambrook Ltd and King's Union Corp -- had entered into a conditional agreement on February 25 with a third party to sell 104.27 million shares in the company.
As of January, King's Union Corp held 24.14 percent of Team Concepts, and Holystone and Hambrook each held 11.07 percent.
King's Union Corp is equally owned by Holystone and Hambrook.

Trading in Team Concepts shares was suspended at its own request on Wednesday. The company said it would apply to the stock exchange for a resumption of trading upon the publication of the offer announcement.
Team Concepts manufactures telephones, answering machines and electronic educational products.
